text.section: The Institution shall compile and maintain a complete record of each inmate transferred to it for evaluation or treatment.

section.section: The Institution shall record a full and accurate description, including photographs, of each inmate transferred to the Institution for treatment.
The Institution may adopt the Bertillon method or any other accurate method of description, measurement, and registration.

In order that the Institution may comply with this section, all State and local officials and units:
shall cooperate with the Institution; and
promptly, on request of the Institution, shall furnish or cause to be furnished to the Institution the information, records, and reports in their possession.
The provisions of § 3-8A-27(b) of the Courts Article do not apply to a request made for juvenile records under this section.

text.section:
Confidential records, reports, or information may be disclosed under subsection (e) of this section only if the Director reasonably believes that the record, report, or information:
will be used solely for the legitimate purposes of the person or unit receiving it; and
will not be further disseminated to any person or unit not authorized to receive it under subsection (e) of this section.

Juvenile records obtained under subsection (d) of this section may be disclosed only:
to a person or unit listed in subsection (e)(1), (2), and (3) of this section; and
in accordance with subsection (f) of this section.
